item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I know now, after fifty years, that the finding/losing, forgetting/remembering, leaving/returning, never stops. The whole of life is about another chance, and while we are alive, till the very end, there is always another chance." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I had no one to help me, but the T. S. Eliot helped me. So when people say that poetry is a luxury, or an option, or for the educated middle classes, or that it shouldn’t be read at school because it is irrelevant, or any of the strange stupid things that are said about poetry and its place in our lives, I suspect that the people doing the saying have had things pretty easy. A tough life needs a tough language – and that is what poetry is. That is what literature offers – a language powerful enough to say how it is. It isn’t a hiding place. It is a finding place." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by A. A. Milne
item.description: "Hallo, Rabbit,” he said, “is that you?” "Let’s pretend it isn’t,” said Rabbit, “and see what happens." -- A. A. Milne

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Nobody can be uncheered with a balloon." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "It is hard to be brave, when you're only a Very Small Animal." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "And by and by Christopher Robin came to the end of things, and he was silent, and he sat there, looking out over the world, just wishing it wouldn't stop." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Supposing a tree fell down, Pooh, when we were underneath it?' 'Supposing it didn't,' said Pooh after careful thought. Piglet was comforted by this." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "I must be overtired', Buttercup managed. 'The excitement and all.' 'Rest then', her mother cautioned. 'Terrible things can happen when you're overtired. I was overtired the night your father proposed." -- William Goldman

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "His heart danced upon her movements like a cork upon a tide. He heard what her eyes said to him from beneath their cowl and knew that in some dim past, whether in life or revery, he had heard their tale before." -- James Joyce

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by Diana Wynne Jones
item.description: "I think we ought to live happily ever after." -- Diana Wynne Jones

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jessica (herself) add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges
